page.title: 04THE VILLAGE OF SCREDINGTON
page.content: My village has one shop with a post office.We have a mobile library and a sweety van which comes around with sweets and groceries.A fish and chip van comes round at 8 o'clock every wednesday. The village school has 26 children between the ages of 5 and 11. Next to the school is a playing field and beyond is a grass field where sheep graze.There are some becks with lots of fish in them gudgeon,roach,catfish,eels and stonefish.It is a very small quiet village.Everyone is kind.There is a big playing field where the older children take the young ones to play cricket and football.There only three buses a day to take people to the nearest town Sleaford four miles away .My dad grows potatoes and peas and at the bottom of our garden there is a sheep field.Lots of people breed dogs.
